stories.text:
For example, in New Zealand: https://www.stuff.co.nz/business/110009318/a-honeypot-for-fraudsters-or-a-simple-way-to-pay-online

That's 3 years ago, and nothing has changed.

As far as I can tell, the 3rd party system has to have your online banking password, because nobody can figure out a reliable way to give a description of a one-off or regular payment in a format such that you can enter it yourself into your online banking without making a silly mistake.
stories.title: Ask HN: How come 3rd party payment systems still exist?

stories.text: I’m looking for opportunities where the market is already primed and proven (will of course be discreet). I’ll build it and ideally give the product access to customers who will pay and also execute a marketing plan on a consistent basis.
stories.title: Ask HN: Developer Seeks Co-Founder with Proven Market
